summary: Build a dark, creepy Hindi horror storytelling website named "Darr Ka Samna" with a black/red cinematic theme, featuring a blog/story system with category-wise browsing, post/article reading pages (Hindi font support), homepage latest stories, search, comments, night mode reading, mobile-friendly layout, share buttons, related posts section, ad/affiliate placement areas, and admin tooling for managing stories and site branding; add media support including story thumbnail image uploads and embedding YouTube video links within stories; add engagement features including automatic public publishing after story creation, per-story view counter (total reads), simpler public comments (name + message), and a follow/subscribe button for users to follow the website; seed the site with the first story "काली फाड़ी की चीखें" (Indian Horror); email subscribe box removed (previously).
architectural_notes: Email subscribe box removed completely (no email subscription feature).
User now requests a follow/subscribe feature, which conflicts with the earlier decision to remove the email subscribe box; define follow mechanism (non-email vs email) before implementation.
Commenting requirement changed to public name+message (no Internet Identity requirement) compared to previous authenticated-comments plan.
known_issues: Deployment/build failed during deployment attempt; user requested automatic retry and error fix.

existing_features.title: Create the core site structure for the horror storytelling website named "Darr Ka Samna" with a consistent dark, mysterious, creepy, cinematic visual theme using a black and deep-red palette and a scary/creepy headline font style while keeping body text highly readable.
Implement a homepage that lists the latest horror stories with story cards (title, short excerpt/preview, category label, and a link to the full story).
Implement category pages for: Indian Horror, Haunted Places, True Stories, Psychological Horror, each showing stories filtered by that category.
Implement an individual story reading page that displays the full story content with a comfortable reading layout and supports a "Night mode" reading toggle for the reading experience.
Add a site-wide story search bar that allows users to search stories by title (and optionally excerpt/content) and shows matching results.
Add a comment section on individual story pages that allows authenticated users (Internet Identity) to post comments and all users to read comments.
Provide dedicated UI placeholders/slots for Google AdSense ads and dedicated sections for Amazon affiliate links, without integrating any external ad/affiliate APIs.
Remove the email subscribe box completely from the product: do not display a subscribe UI, do not store emails, and do not expose any subscription-related actions/endpoints.
Add robust Hindi (Devanagari) font support across the site, ensuring Hindi story titles/content render correctly while keeping the existing horror heading font for English headings.
Add a story thumbnail image placeholder to story listing cards and the full story reading page, using a generated static placeholder image asset.
Add share buttons on the story reading page that allow users to share the current story URL via common share targets, without any external API integrations.
Add a related posts section on the story reading page that shows other stories from the same category, excluding the currently viewed story.
Identify the root cause of the current deployment/build failure and apply code/config changes required so the project builds and deploys successfully when retried.
Create an admin page in the frontend that requires the user to be signed in with Internet Identity and allows uploading, previewing, replacing, and removing the site logo.
Update the site header branding to display the uploaded site logo when available, with a graceful fallback to the current icon + "Darr Ka Samna" text when no logo is set.
Create a new admin page that requires the user to be signed in with Internet Identity and provides a form to create a new horror story with fields: Title, Category, and Full story text.
Add frontend data layer support to create stories by calling the backend addStory method, and invalidate/refetch relevant story queries (latest, category, and search) after a successful create.

Add routing and navigation access for the new admin story page, including a route under /admin (e.g., /admin/stories or /admin/story/new) and a visible navigation entry for authenticated users alongside the existing admin logo link.

Update the admin create-story UI (frontend/src/pages/AdminStoryNewPage.tsx) to allow: (1) uploading an optional thumbnail image for the story, and (2) entering an optional YouTube video link to be displayed on the story page; ensure validation, clear error messages, and that media is saved alongside story creation.

Render story media on public pages: show the story thumbnail on story listing cards and the story reading page when available (fallback to the existing placeholder when not), and embed the YouTube video on the story reading page when a YouTube link exists using a responsive, mobile-friendly layout.
Add a clear "Add Story" button entry in the admin area and ensure admin-related pages and media UI are mobile-friendly (spacing, stacking, and touch targets).
Ensure every newly created story is immediately publicly visible after creation (no draft/private state) and appears in the public latest stories feed without requiring any additional publish action.
Add a per-story view counter that tracks total reads and display the total reads on the story reading page.

Change the public story comments section to support simple public comments with fields: name + message, and allow all visitors (including unauthenticated users) to post and read comments under every story.
Add a follow/subscribe button that lets users follow the website, persist their follow status, and display follower count in the UI without collecting emails.
Maintain the existing dark horror theme and ensure new engagement UI elements (reads count, public comments form, follow button) are fully mobile-friendly and responsive.

Homepage showing latest horror stories
Category pages for Indian Horror, Haunted Places, True Stories, Psychological Horror
Individual story reading page
Site-wide search bar for stories
Comment section on story pages
Night mode reading feature
Mobile-friendly responsive layout
Dedicated spaces/slots for Google AdSense ads
Dedicated spaces/sections to add Amazon affiliate links
Create a blog/story system with post/article page layout for stories
Add Hindi font support/typography for story reading and UI
Add share buttons on story reading pages
Add related posts section on story reading pages
Add thumbnail image placeholder support for story posts
Seed content: add first story titled "काली फाड़ी की चीखें" in category "Indian Horror"
Seed the application with the first story titled "काली फाड़ी की चीखें" in the "Indian Horror" category so it appears in latest stories and category listings.
Add an admin dashboard with login to create, edit, delete stories; support image/video upload, tags, categories, and publish button
Add option in admin panel to upload/update site logo
Add backend support for storing and retrieving a site logo uploaded from the admin panel, including content type metadata.
Admin panel content system to add horror stories (Add Story) with fields: Title, Category, Full story text; publish so homepage shows latest stories in newest-first order
Add media support: allow uploading a thumbnail image for each story via admin and display it on story cards and story pages
Allow adding a YouTube video link within a story (admin input + embed/display on story reading page)
Add an "Add Story" button in the admin panel to start the create-story flow

Extend the backend story model to support media by storing an optional YouTube URL per story and supporting an optional per-story thumbnail image (binary blob + content type) that can be uploaded and retrieved by story id, with admin-only write access and public read access.
Automatically publish every story publicly immediately after creation (no draft/private state)
Add per-story view counter to track and display total reads on story pages (and/or listing cards)
Add a public comment section under every story using simple fields (name + message)
Add a follow/subscribe button so users can follow the website (engagement subscription feature)
